title: virasisog
author: virasisog
created_time: May 03, 2023, 05:54:13 PMLast edit: June 01, 2023, 05:13:45 PM by virasisog
content: I have been in the crypto world for a couple of years and many Bitcoin opportunities have come my way. Last year, I decided to pledge my crypto earnings from signature campaigns, trading profits, and investments to help the Aeta community in our province. I'm in the corporate world while doing crypto as my side job. I've seen the struggle of the native community in our province so I decided to sacrifice my one-year earnings to help them even in the simplest way I know. I collaborated and seek help from the local government sector to pursue this simple charity event. I have realized that Bitcoin won't just help the economy, and us users, but also can reach people who are deeply in need. As I've seen the smile on our native people's faces, all my sleepless nights of hard work have paid off. Bitcoin has opened lots of opportunities for everyone but it could also be a way to reach out to people who are in the poorest of the poor sector. I'm just so overwhelmed with my experience and hope to inspire others to help not just through charity events but in simple ways we can because not everyone is capable of accessing and grabbing Bitcoin opportunities because of their poor situation such as lack of devices and internet supply.Here are some photos that I would love to share. God Bless, everyone!UPDATE: My colleagues and former classmates have heard about the simple charity that I've done and they told me that they will join my plan to run another charity event by the end of the year. It was unexpected and my heart is full knowing that there would be more people who will extend their hands to less fortunate native community. We had a zoom meeting and I shared how I earned to run that gift giving program and they were surprised that I got the funds from my crypto earnings. I also discovered that three of them are also investing in Bitcoin. We still have almost half a year to prepare for it but I hope that we could reach out to higher number of native people. Thanks for your heart warming encouraging words. You've made me feel more motivated to grind and earn so I could help more of them. I know that everyone could do helping in different ways but I'm just so glad that crypto industry has been opening lots of opportunities for us. I believe that all our hard work will pay off in the future.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: I was moved when I saw your story how you actually devoted a part of your earnings to help out your native people and community. I wish I had more people like you in my country, You really are a God sent. Your experience shows us another true potential of  Bitcoin not just to earn and save but also to help out the people in need. This shows that we all can actually make positive difference in the world no matter how big or small it is, we should try to help. May your efforts continue to inspire others to do same.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)

Such a sacrifice requires someone with a good heart. I am impressed by your desire to help the needy and underprivileged with your one-year savings; I know it will not be enough, but it will go a long way toward supporting the community.I hope Bitcoin adoption will go a long way if the community knows you got the money through Bitcoin investment and that the support you provide them will make them realize how important Bitcoin is.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: This is a kind act of generosity from you, mate. I know it really takes some time and a bit of stress to organize this kind of stuff, but you taking out your time to do this shows how kind you are. comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Good job, it’s always a good thing to be generous and I always appreciate such act when I see such but I think we should try to protect the privacy of people, I know you doing a good thing for them but it’s proper to protect their image and maybe blur there faces out of the picture.Personally I am the type of person that like to give out in silent because that’s the best way to give to those in need without making them feel less of a human and to actually give without the intentions of popularity or any other thing, but since the forum is an anonymous one I would say kudos OP.

comments.body: Yes, bitcoin is one thing that has gone far beyond expectations of just transacting anonymously and making these transactions for something betterment. It’s good that you are thinking about community like that and putting all the efforts through use of bitcoin. We have already seen mega world wide donation ti Ukraine and various natural calamities and disaster. I’m pretty sure bitcoins name is being taken positively. comments.author: Cantsay

comments.author: Mate2237

The forum has helped plenty people. According to a saying, those who give freely receive in abundant freely. The opportunities bitcoin has given to the forum users and beyond are many. comments.author: death69
comments.body: Whoa, bro! Way to plonk your cash on the ticker of love! I gotta admit, color me awestruck – and ignited!You know, peeps can get lost in the cryptoverse and leave the tangible realm in the rearview. But yarns like these jolt us back to what the mighty Bitcoin can do – beyond fattening wallets, it’s a catalyst for awesomeness!The cherry on top? You don't need to be the crypto King Midas to rock the boat. Even tiny acts of generosity or compassion can snowball into epic impact.So, let’s all tip our hats to this big-hearted crypto-dynamo and join the revolution! Be it showering Bitcoin love, donating your time, or just being the resident ray of sunshine, that’s what'll make a dent in the universe.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I am at a loss for words, unsure of how to adequately express my gratitude towards you. Your act of charity is a rare and admirable one, and it warms my heart to know that you used your cryptocurrency earnings towards this cause. It doesn't matter what the amount was; sacrificing an entire year's worth of earnings is no easy feat. Your selflessness is truly inspiring, and we can all learn from your example. While we may not be able to make the same level of sacrifice, we can still use our crypto earnings to help others on occasion and experience the same feelings of fulfillment.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Your kind of person is uncommon to find. You have used your one year earnings from the forum for charity,this shows how simple you are for thinking of the poor ones around you to help them. So many people are accumulating their bitcoin for the next bull run but you used yours to spread love to the poor and needy. You have done something very great to those people and they will keep on praying for you.I admire your actions and will learn from you on how to help people who are in need with the little that I have. Giving relief materials to the poor is the most caring thing one needs to do,continue with your good work as this is another way to promote bitcoin. I am overwhelmed with this action of yours. Keep it up

comments.author: Captain Corporate
comments.body: I am not entirely sure if it would be considered the same thing, but back when the big earthquake happened here in Turkey, there were people donating crypto as well. I am not entirely sure how much was raised to be fair, but there were millions and millions of dollars raised without a doubt, and in fiat too obviously. The organization that raised this money went to the government and asked to help, and the government showed them what they can do, so now that money is getting spent to build stuff for the people who lost everything, and I mean everything. People who lost their loved ones, children, spouses, parents, jobs, houses, schools, hospitals, everything. Thanks to this money raised, we can at least build some of that back, not all of it of course, but even if we can help just a bit, that is all we can hope for.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: With what's been shared in this section lately, I truly hope that you're doing this for real. I truly do.
